com.fxgraph.graph

Class ViewportGestures

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fxgraph.graph.ViewportGestures

  • public class ViewportGestures
extends java.lang.Object
    Listeners for making the scene's viewport draggable and zoomable.
    Author:
    sirolf2009, ogallagher (javadoc)

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Type Property and Description
      javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty maxScale 
      javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty minScale 
      javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty zoomSpeed 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private PannableCanvas canvas
      The graph's canvas on which the graph node graphics are displayed.
      private Graph graph
      The graph whose viewport will be updated by these gestures.
      private javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty maxScaleProperty
      Maximum viewport zoom.
      private javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty minScaleProperty
      Minimum viewport zoom.
      private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseDraggedEventHandler
      If the mouse is moved while pressed (drag), potentially update a pan drag.
      private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMousePressedEventHandler
      If a mouse button is pressed, potentially begin a new pan drag.
      private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseReleasedEventHandler
      If a mouse button is released, potentially finish a pan drag.
      private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent> onScrollEventHandler
      Mouse wheel handler: zoom to pivot point.
      private javafx.scene.input.MouseButton panButton
      The mouse button whose drag will update the viewport translation/panning.
      private PannableCanvas.DragContext sceneDragContext
      While a drag is happening (the mouse button has not yet been released), the drag context keeps track of the anchor point and the drag offset from the anchor.
      private javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty zoomSpeedProperty
      How fast the scale changes when scrolling to zoom the viewport.

      • zoomSpeedProperty

        private final javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty zoomSpeedProperty
        How fast the scale changes when scrolling to zoom the viewport.

      • maxScaleProperty

        private final javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty maxScaleProperty
        Maximum viewport zoom.

      • minScaleProperty

        private final javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty minScaleProperty
        Minimum viewport zoom.

      • sceneDragContext

        private final PannableCanvas.DragContext sceneDragContext
        While a drag is happening (the mouse button has not yet been released), the drag context keeps track of the anchor point and the drag offset from the anchor.

      • graph

        private final Graph graph
        The graph whose viewport will be updated by these gestures.

      • canvas

        private final PannableCanvas canvas
        The graph's canvas on which the graph node graphics are displayed.

      • panButton

        private javafx.scene.input.MouseButton panButton
        The mouse button whose drag will update the viewport translation/panning.

      • onMousePressedEventHandler

        private final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMousePressedEventHandler
        If a mouse button is pressed, potentially begin a new pan drag.

      • onMouseDraggedEventHandler

        private final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseDraggedEventHandler
        If the mouse is moved while pressed (drag), potentially update a pan drag.

      • onMouseReleasedEventHandler

        private final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseReleasedEventHandler
        If a mouse button is released, potentially finish a pan drag.

      • onScrollEventHandler

        private final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent> onScrollEventHandler
        Mouse wheel handler: zoom to pivot point. The pivot point is the cursor's viewport coordinates, relative to which all graph nodes are scaled. TODO ogallagher fix scaling, and perhaps use AffineTransform to handle the combination of viewport pan (translation) and zoom (scale).

      • setZoomBounds

        public void setZoomBounds(double minScale,
                          double maxScale)
        Set minimum and maximum zoom/scale levels.
        Parameters:
        minScale - Minimum scale. Default = 0.1
        maxScale - Maximum scale. Default = 10.0

      • clamp

        public static double clamp(double value,
                           double min,
                           double max)
        Limit/clamp a value between a minimum and maximum.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to clamp.
        min - Minimum value; anything below becomes min.
        max - Maximum value; anything above becomes max.
        Returns:
        The clamped value.
